algorithm_technique: Precompute conversion factors from unit 0 to all other units using BFS, then use modular inverse for division in queries.
problem_summary_simple: Calculate unit conversions between any two types, returning results as modular multiplicative inverses.
problem_summary_technical: Uses BFS to establish base conversions from unit 0, then modular inverse and division for arbitrary query conversions.
key_insights: The problem requires handling both forward and inverse conversions, which can be achieved using modular multiplicative inverse.
Pre-calculating conversions from a base unit (unit 0) simplifies query processing.
Fermat's Little Theorem is used for efficient modular inverse calculation (pow(b, MOD-2, MOD)).
